    • ServoPart

      public ServoPart​(HardwareMap hardware, String name)
      Creates a new Servo
      Parameters:
      hardware - The HardwareMap to get the physical servo from
      name - The servo's name in the configuration

  • Method Details

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition​(int position) throws ArithmeticException
      Sets the position of the servo, between 0 and 100
      Parameters:
      position - The position to set
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - The exception thrown when the position is not between 0 and 100

    • stop

      public void stop()

    • getPosition

      public int getPosition()

      Gets the degree of the servo's set position.

      Note that this does not return the physical degree of rotation of the servo, only the position the servo is commanded to be in, as no API returning the true position is exposed by the servo.

      Returns:
      The position of the servo between 0 and 100

      public void setDirection​(Servo.Direction direction)
